alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:51PM CST until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mobile AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Washington, Choctaw and Clarke Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Saturday morning and continue rising to 32.9 feet Monday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob.
